posts.html:
@Donovan_Fabian:
As far as I am aware, life loss caused by Sanguine Bond, et al., is not damage. For something to be considered damage, it must actually have the word "damage" written.

To summarize, damage causes loss of life, but loss of life is not necessarily caused by damage.
Report Abuse

posts.post_content: Paying like =/= damage. Just like sacrificing =/= destroyed.

Thinking of putting it in a player-burn/[Hive Mind](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hive Mind) deck. Burn the opponent, then the opponent has a choice of either burning himself or healing me. Mwahaha.

posts.post_content:
Here's a raw version of a hilarious combo decklist:  
  
4 [Purity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Purity)  
4 [Pestilence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pestilence)  
4 [Souls of the Faultless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Souls of the Faultless)  
4 [Sanguine Bond](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sanguine Bond)  
4 [Mana Tithe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mana Tithe)  
4 [Diabolic Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Diabolic Tutor)  
4 [Dark Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dark Ritual)  
2 [Enlightened Tutor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enlightened Tutor)  
2 [Boon Reflection](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon Reflection)  
4 Open slots ([Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror)? [Sign in Blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sign in Blood)? [Indestructibility](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indestructibility)? Blockers? Up to you)  
  
24 Land  
  
The basic gist behind this deck is using your main card, Pestilence, in combination with Purity to deal yourself and the Souls damage so you gain life and your opponent loses it. Tutors help you find the cards you need and mana tithe gives you control. Souls of the Faultless can be replaced for other control cards, Boon Reflections can be replaced for another 2 Enlightened Tutors, and you can easily transform this deck into a legacy control deck by reducing s... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Lege (12/17/2009 12:18:53 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: @ ultratog, its not burn only its anything except combat damage. This card can save you from thousands of different cards, such as sanguine bond and blood tribute, and turns all your earthquakes into one sided destruction against your enemy and even better you actually gain life, Purity has flying and thus isn't affected by it. You can even use your own burn spells on yourself to regain life in a crisis, lightning helix can regain you 6 life for 2 mana a pop. Secondly, its great for an aggro deck, it can still attack at 6/6, but its real value is that your opponent now -has- to go through your creatures, and if you circulate around having creature advantage such as in red or green, you just cinched the game.
posts.html:

You can even use your own burn spells on yourself to regain life in a crisis, lightning helix can regain you 6 life for 2 mana a pop. Secondly, its great for an aggro deck, it can still attack at 6/6, but its real value is that your opponent now -has- to go through your creatures, and if you circulate around having creature advantage such as in red or green, you just cinched the game.

posts.post_content:
@ Lege [souls of the faultless](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=souls of the faultless) only works with combat damage. I would suggest going red rather then black with [pyrohemia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pyrohemia) and [manabarbs](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=manabarbs).  
[hedron field purists](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=hedron field purists) would also be a cool trick if you don't get [purity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=purity) out  
  
if you do get purity out [Well of Lost Dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Well of Lost Dreams) is also a fun tool.

posts.post_content: This is my second favorite elemental in the cycle. (my first being [Dread](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread)) A 6/6 flier for 6 CMC is already pretty decent, but I just love the second ability. It put's a halt to any burn decks until they find a way to be rid of it, and as many people have stated combos very well with self damaging cards. 4.5/5.
